text: No, we do not support filter on foreign tables..
You can use multiselect column type right?

Hi all, I posted a question about customizing a HubSpot form based on items in a HubDB column Here: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/HubSpot-Form-Dynamic-Multi-Select-Field-based-on-Multi-Select/m-p/324186#M15652>

I wanted to see if anyone here has an answer. :+1:

<@UCR9MN8GZ> sounds similar to my issue with joining across tables.  I got around it by doing some filtering using hubl conditions.  Whether you use javascript or hubl, I think the idea is the same.  You need to gather the product types for the supplier on your item form page.  That should be possible with a query on your supplier table for the specific supplier.

<@UUW9TTR8X> I am using a form field in a custom module. You mentioned using HubL conditions. You're saying I can customize the form's muti-select field in HubL? or are you suggesting passing the item's type tags from HubL to Javascript. If I can avoid using javascript it would make me happy.
if its a fully custom module, you should be able to query the suppliers table and render the multi select with the relevant products
is your form a HubSpot (drag drop) form or did you code it yourself?
drag and drop. You can custom build a form in the COS?
because that would solve my issue, but I don't think that is possible..
i have a module with a custom form built with hubl, but not sure if there's a way to tie it back to a "HubSpot form" for tracking
maybe you can submit the form to a known endpoint with a form id, and get it to behave
The way to tie it back to a HubSpot form would be the form submission API  <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form_v3>
This would have to be hosted third party though, right? Not in the COS?
This is actually one of the few API calls you can make directly from the HubSpot CMS since this isnâ€™t authenticated and allows CORS
This could be all in the JS portion of your module
Thank you <@UFBNA9K9A> this looks like what i needed. If you want to add the answer to the forum i'll accept it, otherwise I'll write something up after I get it working.
